text: Louis Henri Jean Caspers (2 October 1825, Paris – 1906, Paris) was a French pianist and composer. A student at the Conservatoire de Paris, he composed the music for several shows performed among others on the stages of the Théâtre des Bouffes-Parisiens and the Théâtre Lyrique. He abandoned composition in 1861 to take care of business and did not return before 1892.Robert Ignatius Letellier, The Diaries of Giacomo Meyerbeer: 1791-1839, 1999, p. 111 == Works == *1842: Hommage à la mémoire de S. A. R.
